page.title: 02THE COASTGUARD SERVICE
page.content: Hornsea Coastguard covers the area of sea and coast in our block. We went to see Coastguard Davies. He showed us around the Lookout Station. Most of his equipment for observation or communication.When we were there we heard over the radio from a coble in trouble off Filey Brig.Its propeller had dropped off.The Filey Inshore Rescue Boat had gone to tow it back to safety. Mrs.Knapp,an Auxilliary Coast Guard came to school to tell us about her work. Many accidents are caused by holidaymakers who don't know the dangers here.Often they are blown out to sea on air-beds or else they try to use inflatable dinghies which are not safe.She showed us the Rescue Land Rover which was full of all kinds of rescue apparatus. The Coastguard can send for Lifeboats and even the Rescue Helicopters from Leconfield. M.Baker
